alert.note: Alert for Motherlode; Southern Sacramento Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Frost Advisory issued April 03 at 8:49AM PDT until April 04 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT THIS EVENING... ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM PDT TUESDAY... ...MONDAY`S FROST ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 9 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, northwest winds 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph expected. For Tuesday`s Frost Advisory, temperatures as low as 28 to 36 will result in frost formation. * WHERE...For the Wind Advisory, Southern Sacramento Valley from Sacramento south and the lower foothills of the Motherlode. For Tuesday`s Frost Advisory, areas below 2000 feet including the Southern Sacramento Valley and the Motherlode. * WHEN...Wind Advisory from 11 AM to 8 PM today. Frost Advisory from 2 AM to 9 AM PDT Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost could kill sensitive outdoor vegetation if left uncovered. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty northwesterly winds will develop this morning and persist into the early evening, diminishing tonight. Cold temperatures Tuesday morning will allow for areas of frost.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.
